intro: Alchornea pycnogyne, commonly known as the thick-leaved alchornea, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Alchornea pycnogyne is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh climates.
